attributes.action: To properly implement first aid learning in high schools
attributes.additional_details: I was recently involved with a man being hit by a car whilst on his bike I knew first aid but it was lucky that I was there I am only 16 years old and beileve that children should know the basics to first aid just in case they see an incident and no one professional is there to respond
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for children to be taught first aid as it’s an important factor to every day life

rejection.details:
Basic first aid is already taught in schools as part of the physical health and mental wellbeing section of the statutory relationships, sex and health education curriculum.

The module contains information on making an emergency call, the concepts of basic first aid, basic treatment for common injuries, life-saving skills including CPR and understanding defibrillators: 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/relationships-education-relationships-and-sex-education-rse-and-health-education/physical-health-and-mental-wellbeing-primary-and-secondary#physical-health-and-mental-wellbeing-secondary

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Add CPR, Basic Life Support and Defib Training to National Curriculum for 14+: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584705

Add first aid for anaphylaxis to the secondary school national curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593643
